body.p: Cells of the blood are usually easy to identify based on their shape and organelles. Match the four different features to each cell type.

response.feedback: Correct. Red blood cells are the most numerous cells of the blood.
Incorrect. White blood cells are the least, not the most numerous cells of the blood.
Incorrect. Platelets are not the most numerous formed elements of the blood.
Incorrect. This identifies the number of a certain cell type per microliter of blood.
Incorrect. This identifies the number of a certain cell type per microliter of blood.

Incorrect. Platelets are not the least numerous formed elements of the blood.

Correct. Platelets are the less numerous than red blood cells, but more numerous than white blood cells.

Incorrect. This describes the organelles that a certain cell type has.
Incorrect. This describes the organelles that a certain cell type has.
Incorrect. This describes the organelles that a certain cell type has.
Correct. Red blood cells are specialized for transporting oxygen. They have lots of hemoglobin but little else in their cytoplasm.
Incorrect. White blood cells regularly carry out complex functions and adjust protein production. They need nuclei and organelles for these functions.
Incorrect. Platelets do not have nuclei, but they do have granules that are released during platelet aggregation.

Incorrect. Red blood cells are specialized for transporting oxygen. They have lots of hemoglobin but little else in their cytoplasm.
Correct. White blood cells regularly carry out complex functions and adjust protein production. They need nuclei and organelles for these functions.
Incorrect. Platelets do not have nuclei, but they do have granules that are released during platelet aggregation.

Incorrect. Red blood cells are specialized for transporting oxygen. They have lots of hemoglobin but little else in their cytoplasm, not even granules.
Incorrect. White blood cells regularly carry out complex functions and adjust protein production. They need nuclei and organelles for these functions.
Correct. Platelets do not have nuclei, but they do have granules that are released during platelet aggregation.

Incorrect. This describes the shape of a certain type of cell.
Incorrect. This describes the shape of a certain type of cell.
Correct. Red blood cells have a deformable disc shape so that they can squeeze through capillaries.
Incorrect. Disc shaped cells have less volume and white blood cells need more volume because of their large amount of intracellular structures.
Incorrect. Although platelets are disc shaped, they are not as deformable as red blood cells.
Incorrect. This describes the shape of a certain type of cell.

Incorrect. This describes the shape of a certain type of cell.
Incorrect. It would be harder to exchange gases with a spherical cell.
Correct. The spheroid shape of white blood cells provides the volume necessary for all the intracellular organelles of white blood cells.
Incorrect. Platelets are disc shaped in their normal state. They do take on other shapes when activated during hemostasis.

Incorrect. Although red blood cells are disc shaped, they are not rigid.
Incorrect. Disc shaped cells have less volume and white blood cells need more volume because of their large amount of intracellular structures.
Correct. Platelets have a rigid disc shape in their normal state. They do take on other shapes when activated during hemostasis.
